ds.util
Class DiGraphs<T>

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.DiGraphs<T>

public class DiGraphs<T>
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains static methods for the classical graph scanning algorithms, topological sort, strong components, and path optimization.

Constructor Detail

DiGraphs

public DiGraphs()
Method Detail

bfs

public static <T> LinkedList<T> bfs(DiGraph<T> g,
                                    T sVertex)
Performs the breadth-first traversal from sVertex and returns the list of visited vertices.

Parameters:
g - directed graph
sVertex - starting vertex of the breadth-first traversal.
Returns:
list of visited vertices.

path

public static <T> LinkedList<T> path(DiGraph<T> g,
                                     T sVertex,
                                     T eVertex)
Returns a LinkedList that gives a path computed by a graph traversal algorithm from the starting vertex sVertex to the ending vertex eVertex. The method is called after executing path optimization algorithms such as shortestPath, minumumPath and dagMinimumPath to identify the path from a starting vertex and a reachable vertex v.

Parameters:
g - directed graph
sVertex - starting vertex.
eVertex - ending vertex.
Returns:
list of vertices on a path from sVertex to eVertex.

shortestPath

public static <T> void shortestPath(DiGraph<T> g,
                                    T sVertex)
Uses the breadth-first traversal algorithm to determine the minimum number of edges in a path from sVertex to a vertex in the graph reachable from sVertex. upon return, the dataValue field of each vertex in g is either the shortest path length to the vertex or is INFINITY if the vertex was not reacheable from sVertex. call path(g, sVertex, v) to find the shortest path from sVertex to v.

Parameters:
g - directed graph
sVertex - starting vertex.

dfsVisit

public static <T> void dfsVisit(DiGraph<T> g,
                                T sVertex,
                                LinkedList<T> dfsList,
                                boolean checkForCycle)
Depth-first visit takes a starting vertex and creates a list that contains the visited vertices in reverse order of finishing time. When the boolean value checkForCycle is true, the method throws an IllegalPathStateException if it detects a cycle.

Parameters:
g - directed graph
sVertex - starting vertex.
dfsList - List of visited nodes created by the algorithm.
checkForCycle - test whether the presence of a cycle results in an exception.
Throws:
java.awt.geom.IllegalPathStateException - if it detects a cycle when checkForCycle is true.

dfs

public static <T> void dfs(DiGraph<T> g,
                           LinkedList<T> dfsList)
In the depth-first search. dfsList contains all the graph vertices in the reverse order of their finishing times.

Parameters:
g - directed graph
dfsList - list that is created by the depth-first search.

topologicalSort

public static <T> void topologicalSort(DiGraph<T> g,
                                       LinkedList<T> tlist)
The linked list provides a topological sort ordering of the vertices.

Parameters:
g - directed graph
tlist - list that is created to describe a topological sort order of the vertices.

acyclic

public static <T> boolean acyclic(DiGraph<T> g)
Returns true if the graph is acyclic.

Parameters:
g - directed graph
Returns:
true if it detects a cycle.

transpose

public static <T> DiGraph<T> transpose(DiGraph<T> g)
Returns the transpose of the graph.

Parameters:
g - directed graph
Returns:
the transpose of the graph.

strongComponents

public static <T> void strongComponents(DiGraph<T> g,
                                        ArrayList<LinkedList<T>> component)
Depth-first visit takes a starting vertex and creates a list that contains the visited vertices in reverse order of finishing time. When the boolean value checkForCycle is true, the method throws an IllegalPathStateException if it detects a cycle.

Parameters:
g - DiGraph
component - List of visited nodes created by the algorithm.
Throws:
java.awt.geom.IllegalPathStateException - if it detects a cycle when checkForCycle is true.

minimumPath

public static <T> void minimumPath(DiGraph<T> g,
                                   T sVertex)
Finds the path with minimum total weight from sVertex to each vertex in the graph reachable from sVertex. Upon return, the dataValue field of each vertex in graph g is either the minimum path weight to the vertex or is INFINITY if the vertex was not reacheable from sVertex. Call the method path(g, sVertex, v) to find the minimum path from sVertex to v

Parameters:
g - directed graph
sVertex - starting vertex.

dagMinimumPath

public static <T> void dagMinimumPath(DiGraph<T> g,
                                      T sVertex)
In a directed acyclic graph, it finds the path with minimum total weight from sVertex to each vertex reachable from sVertex. Upon return, the dataValue field of each vertex in g is either the minimum path weight to the vertex or is INFINITY if the vertex was not reacheable from sVertex. Call path(g, sVertex, v) to find the minimum path from sVertex to v.

Parameters:
g - directed graph
sVertex - starting vertex.

minSpanTree

public static <T> int minSpanTree(DiGraph<T> g,
                                  DiGraph<T> MST)
Identifies the edges that combine with vertices to form a minimum spanning tree for the connected graph g. Graph g is represented as a digraph with bidirectional edges of equal weight

Parameters:
g - directed graph
MST - vertices and edges that form the minimum spanning tree.
